title: Bug 12906 - Unable to Open File in Another Editor When Already Open (Error Message Missing)
description: Bug 12906 - Unable to Open File in Another Editor When Already Open (Error Message Missing)
OB: When a file is already open in one editor, if you go to the Java Perspective and attempt to open a Java file by double-clicking on it, the file is opened in the workbench. Afterward, right-click on the Java file and choose 'Open With' -> 'System Editor.' When this is done, nothing happens. The expected behavior is that the workbench should display a warning message, indicating that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue. Alternatively, it should show an error message stating that you need to close all files first. We believe this behavior is intended as a safety feature, preventing external editing while a file is already open in the workbench.
EB: When attempting to open a file in another editor that is already open in one editor, the expected behavior is to display a warning message in the workbench. The warning message should inform the user that they may overwrite changes and ask if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be shown, indicating that all files must be closed before opening the file in another editor.
SR:
1. Open a file in an editor.
2. Switch to the Java Perspective.
3. Double-click on a Java file to open it in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the opened Java file.
5. Choose 'Open With' -> 'System Editor.'
6. Observe that no warning or error message is displayed.
